content: Oh hey guys Adam Scottie here welcome to

sculpt it out and then you bake it to 75 in your oven then you're done now the
trick is to get you know it's square like this and flat enough that it will
fit in this type of thing so what I do is I have got a pasta maker okay I just
bought this as a craft store I wasn't super expensive and you can make
different sizes by turning this knob so I'll just put the clay in crank it and
make a sheet okay so that's how I was able to get the thin
part for the door but what I did was I wanted up on both sides so I made two
thin sheets of scully and then carved the detail into the door itself now what
I use for the detail and the door was I use these crochet needles okay a little
better look at those all right you can get these at any big box store or craft
store I like them because they have a curved tip and when you can drag it
through the material and make the detail you can also kind of I use it to kind of
squish it in and make the holes in the in the front where it was kind of sink
holes and then use the smaller one to do kind of drag it through and make the
details so that came out really nice but the trip to getting the door the correct
size for both sides was I made a I made a cardboard template it was the size of
this I rolled it out at my pasta machine so it was all equal width and then I put
it down and then cut out the two square or the two rectangle parts
and did the detail out so what I do is when I'm doing something like this and
eat a really easy way to have it put it on a surface so you don't have to you
can sculpt on the surface and then put it directly in the oven is to just use
aluminum foil okay so what I did is I squeezed it out of the pasta machine put
the piece on the lumina Moyle then I use my template and put it on
made two different copies of the door with just a cardboard template and then
I cut around it with this blade tool so I just put the black clay on this on
this aluminum foil put the template on it cut around it then move the template
here and cut around the next part and then just took all the excess off so I
basically was left with two rectangle pieces that were the same size that I
was going to used for the door then I just used my crochet needles and
sculpted the swirls into the door and then then just bake it and then what I
did was I took the took the two pieces the two small pieces and glued them back
to back together so it made each side of the door and then I used my template and
I was able to do the frame of the door out just this is just out of cardboard
the frame and the base of this card stock and cardboard and then I just used
covered up the edge with our standard door technique so that's really all
there is to it the the sculpting can be really versatile as far as making stuff
like this also the scope ly like I said the skull B is nice because it doesn't
dry you're not living it to a certain amount of time so if you start working
on it you can't finish it or you know whatever you can let it sit and come
back to it so you know that's great and and wooden foil is the perfect thing to
use because you can set your work on it especially something flat like this you
can set your work on it without having to try to peel it up and then put it on
something so you just put the aluminum foil
directly in the oven and you're good to go
